cons: Not always very organised but that is something to work on! :)

pros: People with disabilities and some assistants
cons: Lots of top down stuff, managers not in touch with people, big national bureaucracy doing little, sounds good but

job_title: Support Worker in Preston, North West England, England
pros: Get to know Core Members and bond with them over time. Get days off to explore local area. Meet some good people for sure.
cons: Past Community Leader at location and past House Manager little more than bitter, angry bullies. Prattle on about "faith" yet are nasty more often than not. Revelations about Vanier very sad and tragic but in a way not unsurprising; for example, if a colleague expresses romantic interest in a co-worker, it is assumed the co-worker should fall over themselves with gratitude and happiness at the attention, and if the colleague is ignored (perhaps you have no interest in a romantic relationship) then passive aggressive destruction of your character will begin - cowardly actions to be fair. Overall, not that much of a stretch from that mentality to the heinous actions of Jean Vanier - "God has placed us both here etc." Very disturbing to contemplate!

pros: Very good company I like it
Great for those who love Community. Amazing and diverse colleagues
cons: Can be exhausting emotionally if you are introverted; however engaging in activities outside work help a lot

pros: meeting new people with and without learning disabilities
